meanings.definition: To set a limit or boundary before something happens.
meanings.sent1: She prelimiting her spending to avoid going over budget.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always prelimiting the number of students in each group for better collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prelimiting the nuts it could gather to save some for later.
meanings.sent4: The goalie prelimiting the opponent's chances to score with quick reflexes.
meanings.sent5: By prelimiting distractions, she was able to focus better on her work.

meanings.definition: To establish a limit or boundary in advance.
meanings.sent1: He prelimiting the time he would spend on social media to be more productive.
meanings.sent2: The city council prelimiting the construction of tall buildings to preserve the skyline.
meanings.sent3: The chef prelimiting the ingredients for the recipe to challenge himself.
meanings.sent4: The author prelimiting the plot twists to keep the readers engaged till the end.
meanings.sent5: By prelimiting the number of guests, they ensured everyone had a good time at the party.
